title: Changing Or Cancelling Any Other Requirement

pages.name: Changing Or Cancelling Any Other Requirement

elements.name: ChangingOrCancellingAnyOtherRequirementDescription1
elements.title: description1
elements.body:
Sometimes you might be unable to meet a requirement under the rules. This may include:
  • filing at the court registry that applies under Rule 7
  • meeting the early resolution, family justice or parenting education program registry requirements
  • filing a document with all the required attachments or information
  • meeting a timeline for filing or exchanging documents, like a reply
You can ask the court for permission to change or cancel a requirement under the rules. This may include asking:
  • to be allowed to file your application at another registry
  • for permission to be exempt from completing a needs assessment, parenting education program, or consensual dispute resolution or delaying completion of any early resolution, family justice or parenting education program registry requirements
  • to be allowed to file an application without the required additional documents or without the additional documents being complete
  • to change the time to file a reply or other document
  • to change or cancel a time limit set by an order or direction of a judge

elements.description: Choose from the list below. Select all options that apply. There may be more than one.

elements.name: dateOfOrder
elements.title: Please provide the date the order was made and the name of the judge who made the order.
elements.description: The date and name of the judge should be referenced in the preamble on the order. For example, “Before the Honourable Judge Jones on May 1, 2016”. The date on the court stamp doesn’t always match the date the order was made.
elements.visibleIf: {appliedRequirementsList} contains 'Time limit set by an order or direction of a judge'

elements.title: Judge
elements.name: judgeName
elements.description: Copy the last name of the judge from the order. You may include an initial if one is included on the order.
elements.visibleIf: {appliedRequirementsList} contains 'Time limit set by an order or direction of a judge'

elements.title: Please provide the details of the order you are asking the court to make:
elements.name: orderDetail
elements.description:
You do not need to use any special wording. The key is to be clear about what you mean and what you are asking the court to order. Tell the court the specifics of the order you are applying for. Include:
  • If you want the requirement changed (modified) or cancelled (waived)
  • If you applying to change the requirement, what you want it changed to
The Provincial Court’s Family Law Act Picklist includes commonly used order terms that might be helpful.

elements.name: FAQLegalAdvice
elements.title: I’m not sure what order I need. Where can I get legal assistance?
elements.body:
Understanding the law and making sure you get correct information is important. If you get the wrong information or do not know how the law applies to your situation, it can be harder to resolve your case. Getting advice from a lawyer can help.

Lawyers: To find a lawyer or to have a free consultation with a lawyer for up to 30 minutes, contact the Lawyer Referral Service at 1-800-663-1919

Legal Aid, Duty Counsel and Family Advice Lawyers: To find out if you qualify for free legal advice or representation, contact Legal Aid BC at

1-866-577-2525.


Legal Services and Resources: Visit Clicklaw at www.clicklaw.bc.ca/helpmap to find other free and low-cost legal services in your community

elements.title: The `facts` on which this application is based are as follows:
elements.name: applicationFacts
elements.description:
Give a short summary of the facts you want the court to consider. You do not need to use any special wording. The key is to be clear about what you mean and why you are asking the court to make the order. Try to include:
  • Why you think the court should grant you permission
  • Why you want a requirement changed or cancelled
  • How you plan to make sure the case can continue if the requirement is changed or cancelled
